topics.author: 53a44fea6368722301fd0500

topics.body:
"@HorsesandMuchMOAR":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55619e4463687227046e1100#post_55619e4463687227046e1100
Such tech won't ever happen because of physics.  Large scale mecha would be too vulnerable in wars and would instantly get blown up.  The larger a vehicle is it requires greater and greater amounts of energy to move.

Funnily enough metal gear is the most probable one because they are actually working on walking machines to traverse terrain that vehicles can't go.

!http://i3.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/728/404/ed5.gif!
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55619f8b6368722187f45300#post_55619f8b6368722187f45300

But the GIF's terrain machine looks too ridiculous to walk on mountainous or marshland terrain.
topics.author: 53a44fea6368722301fd0500

topics.body:
"@HorsesandMuchMOAR":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5561a0086368722187455500#post_5561a0086368722187455500
It's not about how cool it looks irl; it's about how well it performs.  That particular machine is practically impossible to tip over and even on slick surfaces it can keep traction and it can incline at a greater degree than most vehicles.

The reason why the DoD is investing in such robots is that the afghanistan war lasted so long because the taliban was in terrain that vehicles couldn't go.  They're essentially making machines that makes guerrilla warfare ineffective.


Essentially:
The taliban hid in the mountains and that's why the war took so long -> the DoD is working towards vehicles that can climb cliff faces.


It would kind of be hard for guerrilla fighters to hide in mountains if the military can just drive a fucking tank up the side of a cliff.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5561a49763687260d2e10200#post_5561a49763687260d2e10200
They would be ungodly difficult to maneuver unless you're talking about something like Gradius where it is a mech but you only need the mech form for very specific things.  The only reason why you would need a mech form is for grabbing onto things but then it would look more like Vic Viper from Z.O.E. where it can be both a mech and a spaceship and a plane.

However a full blown humanoid mecha would be really fucking hard to maneuver.
